description:
I am using a Nova version 2014.2.2 setup with VirtIO. I am trying to attach a volume via VirtIO driver to a machine with an ISO boot image. However, nova does not create a configuration for the volume attaching it via VirtIO but rather via IDE. The following steps are causing the problem.

First I create a new instance, which works fine:

nova boot --flavor 1 --image gentoo.iso --nic net-id=bea32667-0d4d-4546-877a-9cff5551d164 test-vm

Then I try to attach a volume via VirtIO. I will explain, why I use vdb later:

nova volume-attach test-vm 28c2ce69-4430-4216-8758-3fe4a3d8d322 /dev/vdb

The volume is then attached as /dev/hdb to the instance instead of /dev/vdb. The log shows the following:

2015-02-25 16:44:04.028 10549 DEBUG nova.compute.utils [req-934ddef9-103a-4ad0-b05c-12f0857b9174 None] Using /dev/hd instead of /dev/vd get_next_device_name /usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/nova/compute/utils.py:174

When I try to attach the volume to /dev/vda it fails completely, because then Nova tries to attach it to /dev/hda that it assumes to be already occupied by the cdrom emulation with the ISO image.

I looked into the utils.py file and could not really figure out the reason why the prefix is created based on the root device name. So I am not sure whether this is a bug or intended functionality. In the latter case I would appreciate an explanation especially how to enforce the attachment via VirtIO only for the one device in question.

Thank you and best regards
title: Volume cannot be attached via VirtIO while batting from ISO

comments.content:
This is a wishlist item as the code is currently designed to work this way
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/compute/utils.py#L143
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~dims-v

comments.content: Ok, it is good to hear that the code is expected to work that way. However, I find the explanation for the method confusing, thus leading me to the assumption of a bug. Because in my case device actually is set with e.g. /dev/vdb but the method still returns /dev/hdb. Based on the method description I did not expect that kind of behavior. For me it is fine so far since I patched the file for my installation, still I would suggest to at least clarify the method description to avoid confusion in the future.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~anselm-busse

This wishlist bug has been open a year without any activity. I'm going

of older requests that have come on. If you decide to work on this
consider using a blueprint [1] (maybe with a spec [2]). I'll recommend to 
read [3] if not yet done.
